original_solution_mapping.L2: He was buying 4 books, so these 2 were 25% off so 28.00 * .25 = $7.00
original_solution_mapping.L3: These two books came out to 28-7 = $<<28-7=21.00>>21.00
original_solution_mapping.L5: When you add all 4 books together, 21+20 = $<<21+20=41.00>>41.00

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2289.
    Returns: how much more money Connor needed to spend to receive free shipping.
    """
    # L1
    book1_cost = 13.00 # Book 1 cost 13.00
    book2_cost = 15.00 # Book 2 cost 15.00
    cost_book1_book2_original = book1_cost + book2_cost

    # L2
    num_discounted_books_text = 2 # the first two were 25% off
    discount_percent_text_val = 25 # 25% off
    discount_percent_decimal = 0.25 # 25% off
    discount_amount = cost_book1_book2_original * discount_percent_decimal

    # L3
    cost_book1_book2_after_discount = cost_book1_book2_original - discount_amount

    # L4
    book3_book4_cost_each = 10.00 # Book 3 & 4 were both $10.00 each
    num_books_3_4 = 2 # Book 3 & 4
    cost_book3_book4 = num_books_3_4 * book3_book4_cost_each

    # L5
    total_num_books = 4 # when you buy 4 books
    total_cost_books = cost_book1_book2_after_discount + cost_book3_book4

    # L6
    free_shipping_threshold = 50.00 # free shipping over $50.00
    money_needed_for_free_shipping = free_shipping_threshold - total_cost_books

    # FA
    answer = money_needed_for_free_shipping
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Book 1 was $12.50 and book 2 was $15.00 so {book1_cost} +{book2_cost} = ${cost_book1_book2_original}
He was buying 4 books, so these {num_discounted_books_text} were {discount_percent_text_val}% off so {cost_book1_book2_original} * {discount_percent_decimal} = ${discount_amount}
These two books came out to {cost_book1_book2_original}-{discount_amount} = $<<{cost_book1_book2_original}-{discount_amount}={cost_book1_book2_after_discount}>>{cost_book1_book2_after_discount}

When you add all {total_num_books} books together, {cost_book1_book2_after_discount}+{cost_book3_book4} = $<<{cost_book1_book2_after_discount}+{cost_book3_book4}={total_cost_books}>>{total_cost_books}

To get free shipping he would need to spend {free_shipping_threshold}-{total_cost_books} = $<<{free_shipping_threshold}-{total_cost_books}={money_needed_for_free_shipping}>>{money_needed_for_free_shipping} more on books

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He was buying 4 books, so these 2 were 25% off so 28 * 0.25 = $7
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: These two books came out to 28-7 = $<<28-7=21>>21
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: When you add all 4 books together, 21+20 = $<<21+20=41>>41

explanation: Incorrect final answer. An intermediate value 'total_cost_books' (value: 41.0) was reported instead of 'money_needed_for_free_shipping' (value: 9.0).
